title: Video tech company Atomos kicks off raising
text:
Video editing hardware company Atomos has launched an equity raising to fund a new acquisition and take advantage of emerging market growth opportunities.

The company is hoping to raise $22 million via a two tranche placement offer at a price of $1.30, an 8.1 per cent discount to its last close of $1.42.

One of Atomos' video display screens. Supplied

Atomos entered a trading halt on Wednesday morning, with bids for the placement due by 4pm today. It will restart trading on Friday when it will announce the institutional placement details to the market.

Morgans is the lead manager on the deal with independent advisory firm Henslow as joint bookrunner.

The first tranche will be an issue of 15.3 million shares. The second tranche is an issue of 1.6 million shares and is subject to shareholder approval at the company's annual general meeting at the end of the month.
description: Video editing hardware company Atomos has launched an equity raising, with Morgans as the lead manager on the deal.
